borough: London Borough of Barking and Dagenham
decision_conditions: <p>The proposed development would result in unneighbourly levels of noise generation, increased comings-and-goings and general disturbances, which are considered wholly inappropriate in a residential setting. Additionally, the scale, siting and design of the proposed development would result in an increased sense of overbearingness, overshadowing and a harmful loss of outlook to neighbouring occupiers, therefore constituting unneighbourly development and contrary to: - National Planning Policy Framework (NPPF) (DLUHC, 2021);- Policies D4,&nbsp; D14, D13 and T4 of the London Plan (March 2021);- Policies CM1 and CP3 of&nbsp;Local Development Framework (LDF) Core Strategy (July 2010);- Policies BR13, BP8 and BP11 of the&nbsp;Local Development Framework (LDF) Borough Wide Development Plan Document (DPD) (March 2011);- Policies SP2, SP4, DMSI3, DMD1 and DMD6 of&nbsp;The London Borough of Barking and Dagenham’s Draft Local Plan: (<span style="background-image: initial; background-position: initial; background-size: initial; background-repeat: initial; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial;">Regulation 19 Submission Version, December 2021</span>)<br></p>

<p>The&nbsp;<span style="background-image: initial; background-position: initial; background-size: initial; background-repeat: initial; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial;">proposed development&nbsp;</span>introduces a substantial non-residential building, the scale, siting and design of which&nbsp;<span style="background-image: initial; background-position: initial; background-size: initial; background-repeat: initial; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial;">are not considered appropriate given the site’s established arrangement as a residential dwelling. The development</span>&nbsp;would appear disproportionate to the scale of the retained building, constituting overdevelopment of the plot.<br style="">As such, the development is contrary to: - National Planning Policy Framework (DLUHC , 2021); - Policies D3, D4 and H2 of the London Plan (March 2021); - Policies CM1 and CP3 of the LDF Core Strategy (July 2010); - Policies BP8 and BP11 of the LDF Borough Wide Development Plan Policies DPD (March 2011); - Policies SP2, SP4, DMD1 and DMD6 of the Draft Local Plan (Regulation 19&nbsp;<span style="background-image: initial; background-position: initial; background-size: initial; background-repeat: initial; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial;">Submission Version, December 2021)</span>&nbsp;<br></p>

<p>The principle of development of a new multi-purpose community facility is not supported at the site’s location. The site is within a residential setting which is situated outside a designated neighbourhood centre, where community uses are encouraged. As such the proposed use would be considered inappropriate development in this location. The proposed development is contrary to:<br></p><p class="Default"><o:p></o:p></p><p></p><p class="MsoNormal">- National Planning Policy Framework (DLUHC, 2021); - Policies S1 and GG1 of the London Plan (March 2021); - Policy CC2 of the LDF Core Strategy (July 2010)</p>

<p>The increase in comings-and-goings by car to the application site will result in increased pressures on traffic congestion and parking pressures,&nbsp; further intensifying the degree of noise and disturbance generated at and surrounding the application site as a result of the proposed development. As such, the development is contrary to: - National Planning Policy Framework (NPPF) (DLUHC, 2021);- Policies D14, T6 and T4 of the London Plan (March 2021);-&nbsp;Policy CP3 of the Local Development Framework (LDF) Core Strategy (July 2010);-&nbsp;Policies BR9, BR10, BR13, BP8 and BP11 of the&nbsp;Local Development Framework (LDF) Borough Wide Development Plan Document (DPD) (March 2011);-&nbsp;Policies SP4, DMSI3 and DMT2 of&nbsp;The London Borough of Barking and Dagenham’s Draft Local Plan: (<span style="background-image: initial; background-position: initial; background-size: initial; background-repeat: initial; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial;">Regulation 19 Submission Version, December 2021</span>)<br></p>
subdivision_of_building: Existing property will not be changed at all. The proposal will create a new outbuilding at the rear of the application site.
description: Construction of an outbuilding to the rear of the property, consisting of a basement and ground floor for use as a Multi-purpose community Facility (Class use F2(b)).

constraints_details.result: 28 Upney Lane, Barking, Barking And Dagenham, IG11 9LW
